bug.short_desc: Refactor dimension API for improved support and compatibility

long_desc.thetext:
The Dimension API (qx.bom.element.Dimension) currently contain methods to detect the scroll and client dimensions which are both quite useless because of browser differences.
I would like some different size types which do make sense for the users. In fact I think the classical box size (border box) is the most wanted size as it reflects the visible size of an element. Next I would see some kind of content size which reflects the inner size - or content size - which may jump automatically to the scroll size when the inner size is larger than the outer box.
getWidth getHeight getContentWidth getContentHeight
I do not think that there is a need for other dimensions as well (e.g. padding, but no border, or something like border box + margin). What do you think?
I have implemented both methods getContentWidth/getContentHeight and updated other the migration data and other classes using the old API. Available with revision 17821/trunk.
